text: The Dead Hand: The Untold Story of the Cold War Arms Race and its Dangerous Legacy is the winner of the 2010 Pulitzer Prize for General Non-Fiction written by Washington Post contributing editor David E. Hoffman. The book is based on a large number of published and unpublished sources, including interviews with political leaders, scientists, military officials and diplomats. The Russian automatic nuclear-control system known as "Dead Hand" is described in detail. ==See also== * Dr. Strangelove == External links == * * Review in New York Times *Discussion on The Dead Hand with Hoffman, Woodrow Wilson International Center, October 19, 2009 *Discussion on The Dead Hand with Hoffman, National Book Festival, September 25, 2010 * Home page for The Dead Hand * Article by Peter Preston in the Guardian Category:Pulitzer Prize for General Non-Fiction-winning works Category:2009 non-fiction books Category:Doubleday (publisher) books
